summary: This script checks if the string "Ubuntu is a Linux OS" contains the substrings "Linux" and "UNIX". If it finds "Linux", it prints "String is there." Otherwise, it prints "NOT THE CASE".

details.comment: This script checks if the string "Ubuntu is a Linux OS" contains the substrings "Linux" and "UNIX". If it finds "Linux", it prints "String is there." Otherwise, it prints "NOT THE CASE".
details.content:
STR='Ubuntu is a Linux OS'
SUBSTR='Linux'
if [[ "$STR" == *"$SUBSTR"* ]]; then
  echo "String is there."
fi
STR='Ubuntu is a Linux OS'
SUBSTR='UNIX'
if [[ "$STR" == *"$SUBSTR"* ]]; then
  echo "String is there."
else
	echo NOT THE CASE
fi
